Questions.QuestionString: 1. Traditionally, what are used for the storage medium?
2. What is a disadvantage of microfilm and microfiche?
Answers: A. They have a low capacity

B. Special equipment was needed to magnify the images so that they could be viewed. The
microfilm or microfiche was useless if the viewing equipment malfunctioned, or if it was not
available when the information needed to be accessed
C. They have a slow access speed

Questions.QuestionString: 3. ROM is stand for?
4. In old B777 aircraft, what are traditionally use by flight crew for accessing information?
5. In modern B777 aircraft, what are use by flight crew for accessing information?
6. TWLU stand for?
7. LAN stand for?
8. CIU stand for?
9. What kind of technology is used by maintenance personnel?
10. What statement is correct?
Answers: A. Flight crews need to access the EFB’s information while in flight
B. Flight crews need to access the EFB’s information while in on ground only
C. Flight crews do not need to access the EFB’s information while in flight

Questions.QuestionString: 11. What statement is correct?
Answers:
A. Maintenance personnel need to access different kinds of information while the aircraft is in
flight.

B. Maintenance personnel need to access different kinds of information while the aircraft is on
the ground.

C. Maintenance personnel need to access different kinds of information while the aircraft is on
the ground and in flight

Questions.QuestionString: 12. What are advantages of using electronic format?
Answers: A. The space and weight saving
B. The ability to quickly locate the designed information
C. The space and weight saving, the ability to quickly locate the designed information

Questions.QuestionString: 13. Which system provide advantages to the cabin crew?
14. AIMS stand for?
15. What advantage of modern computer?
Answers: A. It can store very large amounts of information
B. It can process very large amounts of information
C. It can store and process very large amounts of information

Questions.QuestionString: 16. What allows the 777 Electronic Flight Bag database to be wirelessly updated?
Answers:
A. The TWLU contains a radio transmitter and receiver that creates a Local Area Net work
(LAN) bet ween the airplane and a ground-based network

Questions.QuestionString: 17. What information does MMR provide?
18. What are databases accessible through the EFB?
Answers: A. Aeronautical charts, airport maps and charts with real-time position monitoring, manuals

B. Manuals, minimum
equipment lists, and logbooks

C. Aeronautical charts, airport maps and charts with real-time position monitoring, manuals,
minimum
equipment lists, and logbooks

Questions.QuestionString: 19. What statement is correct?
Answers: A. Information system furnish a means of storing, updating and retrieving digital information
B. Information system furnish a means of storing, updating digital information
C. Information system furnish a means of storing, retrieving digital information

Questions.QuestionString: 20. DU stand for?
21. MMR stand for
22. What information does The flight attendant’s manual contains for cabin crew members?
Answers:
A. Check lists, procedures, secuity information, and information about safety devices and
systems on the aircraft
B. Check lists, procedures, secuity information
C. Information about safety devices and systems on the aircraft

Questions.QuestionString: 23. What statement is correct?
Answers:
A. Smartphones are very well suited for storing and retrieving maintenance information in the
aviation maintenance environment

B. Laptop computers are very well suited for storing and retrieving maintenance information in
the aviation maintenance environment

C. EFBs are very well suited for storing and retrieving maintenance information in the aviation
maintenance environment

Questions.QuestionString: 24. What data does the EFB system receives from?
25. What is the purpose of an electronic flight bag?
Answers: A. Electronic information storage system for pilots

B. EFB to access information that would traditionally have been found in various printed
publications and carried aboard in a flight bag.
C. replacing traditional printed navigation charts

Questions.QuestionString:
26. Examples are aircraft general information systems
include: flight deck information systems, maintenance
information systems, and__________________information systems.
27. An electronic flight bag (EFB) is part of the__________________information system

28. On a 777 equipped with the EFB, the system displays
information on __________________ that are installed
on the flight deck.

29. Maintenance crews use maintenance manuals,
illustrated parts catalogs, wiring diagram manuals,
service bulletins, and other technical data stored in the
__________________.

30. A __________________ computer can be used to access
electronically stored maintenance information of the
aircraft.
31. What digital electronics do allows flight attendants to access information?
Answers: C. a computer tablet that contains the manual.

Questions.QuestionString: 32. What purpose of update the information for miscellaneous information system?
Answers: A. to ensure that the most up-to-date version is being used
B. to comply with recommend from manufactures
C. to comply with maintenance procedures from the operator

Questions.QuestionString:
33. Reduced weight, reduced bulk and ease of updating are
advantages of electronic aircraft __________________
systems.
34. How to update the 777 Electronic Flight Bag’s databases
Answers: A. they can be updated through the aircraft’s data loader

B. they can be updated through the aircraft’s data loader, but they can also be updated
wirelessly
C. they can be updated wirelessly

Questions.QuestionString: 35. What statement is correct?
Answers: A. The TWLU contains a radio transmitter only
B. The TWLU contains LAN only

C. The TWLU contains a radio transmitter and receiver
that creates a Local Area Net work (LAN) bet ween
the airplane and a ground-based network

Questions.QuestionString: 36. Instead of maps and charts, maintenance crews use
Answers: A. Maintenance manuals, wiring diagrams, parts catalogs, Airworthiness directions
B. Structure repair manuals, wiring diagrams, parts catalogs, service bulletins

C. Maintenance manuals, illustrated parts catalogs, wiring diagram manuals, service bulletins,
and other technical data.

Questions.QuestionString: 37. The three domains in the Network Server System are known as:
Answers: A. Avionics domain; Flight operations; Communications domain
B. Avionics domain; Flight operations; Communications and cabin domain
C. Avionics domain; Cabin operations; Communications and cabin domain

Questions.QuestionString: 38. In the 777 system, How to the EUs send information to the DUs
39. What statement is correct?
Answers:
A. The information displayed on the DCDU provided to the flight crew from the ATC ground
centres

B. The information displayed on the DCDU provided to the flight crew from the VOR ground
centres

C. The information displayed on the DCDU provided to the flight crew from the ATC ground
centres and enables the crew to send responses to ATC messages received

Questions.QuestionString: 40. The flight operations domain consists of:
Answers: B. a server and terminals in the flight deck
C. a server, router and terminals in the flight deck

Questions.QuestionString: 41. What statement is correct?
Answers:
A. ATIMS provides a means for a swift transfer of data via datalink between airplane and
ground stations
B. ATIMS provides a means for a swift transfer of data via datalink between airplanes only
C. ATIMS provides a means for a swift transfer of data via datalink between ground stations

Questions.QuestionString: 42. The software loaded into the ATSU includes ?
Answers: A. ATSU Airplane Interface software, ATSU configuration software

B. ATSU Airplane Interface software, ATSU configuration software, ATSU router software,
Airline Operation Control software, Airline Operation Control databases, ATC FANS A+
applications.

C. ATSU Airplane Interface software, ATSU configuration software, ATSU router software,
Airline Operation Control software
